item.title: 美国联邦航空局飞行员安全信息发布系统中断后恢复运行
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）和航空公司表示，美国联邦航空管理局向飞行员提供安全信息的一个系统在周六经历了几个小时的故障，然后才恢复运行。【原文：A U.S. Federal Aviation Administration system that provides safety messages to pilots experienced an outage for several hours on Saturday before resuming operations, the agency and airlines said.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，OpenAI、Meta 正在与 Reliance 商谈人工智能合作事宜
item.description: 据科技新闻网站 The Information 周六报道，OpenAI 和 Meta Platforms 已分别与印度信实工业公司（Reliance Industries）就潜在的合作关系进行了讨论，以扩大其在印度的人工智能产品。【原文：OpenAI and Meta Platforms have held separate discussions with India's Reliance Industries over potential partnerships to expand their artificial intelligence offerings in the country, technology news website The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 独家报道一些欧洲官员权衡特朗普执政后能否依赖美联储提供美元
item.description: 六位熟悉内情的人士说，一些欧洲央行和监管官员正在质疑，在市场面临压力时，他们是否还能依靠美国联邦储备局提供美元资金，这让人们对一直以来金融稳定的基石产生了一些怀疑。【原文：Some European central banking and supervisory officials are questioning whether they can still rely on the U.S. Federal Reserve to provide dollar funding in times of market stress, six people familiar with the matter said, casting some doubt over what has been a bedrock of financial stability.】

item.title: 国防部长称意大利与星链公司的交易陷入僵局
item.description: 意大利国防部长周六表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旗下卫星互联网运营商星链公司（Starlink）与意大利政府之间的潜在合同谈判已陷入僵局，这反映出更广泛的地缘政治紧张局势。【原文：Negotiations on a potential contract between Elon Musk's satellite internet operator Starlink and the Italian government have stalled, reflecting broader geopolitical tensions, Italy's defence minister said on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国人工智能竞争日趋激烈，腾讯推出 T1 推理模型
item.description: 中国科技巨头腾讯公司周五晚推出了其 T1 推理模型的正式版本，加剧了中国日益拥挤的人工智能领域的竞争。【原文：Chinese tech giant Tencent on Friday night launched the official version of its T1 reasoning model, stepping up competition in China's increasingly crowded artificial intelligence sector.】

item.title: 卡尼表示，加拿大的目标是实现可抵消美国关税的内部自由贸易
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周五表示，加拿大可以通过消除国内贸易壁垒来抵消美国关税的影响，他的目标是在与各省和地区领导人会晤后，在7月1日前实现国内自由贸易。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney on Friday said Canada could offset the effects of any U.S. tariffs by removing internal trade barriers and that he aimed for free trade within the country by July 1, after meeting provincial and territorial leaders.】

item.title: 科蒂公司向SKIMS出售金-卡戴珊美容品牌股份
item.description: CoverGirl 的母公司科蒂公司（Coty）周五表示，将把真人秀明星金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）美容品牌 20% 的股份出售给她的服装品牌 SKIMS，将这两项业务合并为一个品牌。【原文：CoverGirl parent Coty said on Friday it would sell its 20% stake in reality TV star Kim Kardashian's beauty brand to her clothing line, SKIMS, consolidating the two businesses under a single brand.】

item.title: 美国之音员工就美资新闻机构被关闭一事起诉特朗普政府
item.description: 美国之音 "的员工、记者和工会周五在纽约起诉特朗普政府，称关闭美国资助的新闻机构侵犯了员工的新闻自由第一修正案权利。【原文：Voice of America employees, journalists and unions sued the Trump administration in New York on Friday, saying that the shutdown of U.S.-funded news agencies violated the workers' First Amendment right to journalistic freedom.】

item.title: Contrarian Funds 的 37 亿美元报价被推荐作为 Citgo 母公司拍卖的起拍价
item.description: 据周五提交的一份法院文件显示，负责监督委内瑞拉炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司股份拍卖的一名美国法院官员建议法官选择 Contrarian Funds 关联公司提出的 37 亿美元报价，作为今年新一轮竞价的底价。【原文：A U.S. court officer overseeing an auction of shares in the parent of Venezuela-owned refiner Citgo Petroleum is recommending a judge choose a $3.7 billion offer by an affiliate of Contrarian Funds to set the floor for a new bidding round this year, according to a court filing on Friday.】

item.title: 美国交通部长将公布空中交通管制升级计划
item.description: 美国运输部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）周五表示，他将于下周公布一项计划，对老化、人员不足的美国空中交通管制系统进行升级。【原文：Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy will unveil a plan next week to upgrade the aging, under-staffed U.S. air traffic control system next week, he said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国空军有哪些战斗机项目？
item.description: 波音公司击败了洛克希德-马丁公司，获得了制造美国空军迄今为止最先进的战斗机（F-47）的合同，该项目价值超过 200 亿美元。【原文：Boeing has been awarded the contract to build the U.S. Air Force's most sophisticated fighter jet yet, dubbed the F-47, beating out competition from Lockheed Martin for a program worth more than $20 billion.】

item.title: 阿根廷暂停电信公司对西班牙电信公司的收购
item.description: 阿根廷总统办公室周五表示，已采取预防措施，暂停电信公司收购西班牙电信公司（Telefonica）本地部门的交易，称这一悬而未决的合并可能导致市场过度集中。【原文：Argentina's presidential office on Friday said it issued a preventive measure to suspend Telecom's acquisition of Telefonica's local unit, claiming the pending merger could lead to excessive market concentration.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，国际货币基金组织将在非正式会议上审议 200 亿美元的阿根廷协议
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，国际货币基金组织（IMF）将在下周的一次非正式会议上讨论向阿根廷提供 200 亿美元的新贷款。【原文：The International Monetary Fund (IMF) will discuss a new $20 billion loan for Argentina during an informal meeting next week, Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 交易日：盘整等待关税明朗
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 2024 年雪佛龙首席执行官迈克尔-沃斯的薪酬为 3270 万美元
item.description: 根据向美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）提交的文件，雪佛龙公司周五表示，公司董事长兼首席执行官迈克尔-沃思（Michael Wirth）2024 年的薪酬总额为 3270 万美元。【原文：Chevron said on Friday its chairman and chief executive officer Michael Wirth's total compensation in 2024 was $32.7 million, according to a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.】

item.title: 哥斯达黎加政府的 Youtube 账户遭受网络攻击
item.description: 哥斯达黎加政府周五表示，其官方 Youtube 账户遭受了网络攻击，并在一份声明中补充说，政府正在努力恢复访问。【原文：Costa Rica's government said on Friday that its official Youtube account had suffered a cyber attack, adding in a statement that it was working to regain access.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，前 Cruise 首席执行官沃格特的机器人初创公司在新一轮融资中估值 20 亿美元
item.description: 消息人士告诉路透社，自动驾驶汽车公司 Cruise 前首席执行官凯尔-沃格特（Kyle Vogt）在格林奥克斯（Greenoaks）领投的新一轮融资中为其机器人初创公司 The Bot Company 筹集到了 1.5 亿美元资金，使这家成立不到一年的公司估值达到了 20 亿美元。【原文：Kyle Vogt, former CEO of self-driving car company Cruise, has raised $150 million in a new funding round led by Greenoaks for his robotics startup The Bot Company, valuing the firm launched less than a year ago at $2 billion, sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 票务市场 StubHub 申请在美国上市
item.description: 在线票务市场 StubHub 周五提交了在美国首次公开募股的申请。【原文：Online ticketing marketplace StubHub on Friday filed for an initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 特朗普计划整顿监管，美国证券交易委员会举行加密货币工作组圆桌会议
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会加密货币工作组周五与专家们举行了首次公开会议，重点讨论了在特朗普政府寻求全面修订加密货币法规之际，证券法可能如何适用于数字资产。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's crypto task force held its first public meeting with experts on Friday, focusing on how securities laws might apply to digital assets as the Trump administration looks to overhaul cryptocurrency regulations.】

item.title: 消息人士称，DigitalBridge 领导的集团正在推进收购 WideOpenWest 的潜在交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，包括 DigitalBridge 和 Crestview Partners 在内的一个集团正试图达成收购 WideOpenWest 的交易，这将为长达一年之久的将这家宽带和有线电视服务提供商私有化的努力画上句号。【原文：A group including DigitalBridge and Crestview Partners is attempting to clinch a deal to acquire WideOpenWest , in what would cap a year-long effort to take the broadband and cable services provider private, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴克莱因 177 亿美元发行失误在美国打赢两场官司
item.description: 周五，巴克莱银行赢得了两起美国证券欺诈诉讼的撤诉，这两起诉讼的起因是这家英国银行在未经授权的情况下多出售了 177 亿美元的证券，超出了美国监管机构的允许范围。【原文：Barclays won the dismissal on Friday of two U.S. securities fraud lawsuits stemming from the British bank's unauthorized sale of $17.7 billion more securities than U.S. regulators allowed.】

item.title: 加密货币公司创始人在美国承认操纵市场计划罪
item.description: 一家加密货币金融服务公司的创始人周五承认了美国对他的指控，即他参与了一个大范围的计划，代表客户公司操纵数字代币市场。【原文：The founder of a cryptocurrency financial services firm pleaded guilty on Friday to U.S. charges that he participated in a wide-ranging scheme to manipulate the market for digital tokens on behalf of client companies.】

item.title: 加拿大反对派和石油公司首席执行官呼吁废除联邦碳价格体系
item.description: 在 14 位石油和天然气公司首席执行官以及反对党领袖本周呼吁废除加拿大已实施六年之久的碳定价制度之后，该制度的未来摇摇欲坠。【原文：The future of Canada's six-year-old carbon pricing system is on shaky ground after 14 oil and gas CEOs and the political opposition leader this week called for its repeal.】

item.title: ByteDance 现有投资者成为 TikTok 交易谈判的领跑者
item.description: 据两位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士透露，由白宫主导的关于 TikTok 未来的谈判正围绕一项计划展开，即母公司字节跳动最大的非中国投资者将增持股份，并收购该短视频应用在美国的业务。【原文：White House-led talks on the future of TikTok are coalescing around a plan for the biggest non-Chinese investors in parent company ByteDance to up their stakes and acquire the short video app's U.S. operations, according to two sources familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 特朗普与保罗-韦斯律师事务所的交易引发律师界恐慌
item.description: 华尔街强大的律师事务所保罗-魏斯（Paul Weiss）周五因与白宫达成交易以逃避危及该事务所业务的行政命令而遭到猛烈抨击，尽管一些律师表示该事务所几乎没有其他选择。【原文：Powerful Wall Street law firm Paul Weiss faced heavy criticism on Friday over a deal it struck with the White House to escape an executive order imperiling the firm's business, even as some lawyers said the firm faced few other options.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国油气钻机数三周来首次上升
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周增加了石油和天然气钻机，为三周来首次。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for the first time in three weeks, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储报告 2024 年全面净亏损 775 亿美元
item.description: 美联储周五表示，与 2023 年相比，美联储去年在运营方面面临的损失有所减少。【原文：The Federal Reserve said on Friday the loss it faced last year on its operations declined relative to 2023.】

item.title: 雅虎达成向投资公司出售 TechCrunch 的协议
item.description: 雅虎与媒体投资公司 Regent 周五表示，雅虎已签署协议，将向 Regent 出售其拥有 20 年历史的科技新闻网站 TechCrunch。【原文：Yahoo has signed a deal to sell its 20-year-old technology news website, TechCrunch, to media investment firm Regent, the companies said on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普与习近平会谈在即，美国贸易代表将会见中国贸易代表
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，他的最高贸易主管贾米森-格里尔计划下周与中国贸易部长通话，并重申他计划利用关税来帮助缩小美国与其主要经济对手之间的贸易逆差。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday his top trade chief, Jamieson Greer, plans to speak with his Chinese counterpart next week and reiterated his plan to use tariffs to help narrow the U.S. trade deficit with its main economic rival.】

item.title: 美国联邦通信委员会调查中国科技和电信公司是否试图逃避美国限制
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周五表示，正在对华为、中兴、杭州海康威视、中国移动、中国电信等中国公司进行调查，以确定它们是否在设法规避美国的限制。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission said Friday it is investigating Chinese companies including Huawei Technology, ZTE , Hangzhou Hikvision , China Mobile , China Telecom and others to determine if they are seeking to evade U.S. restrictions.】
